summary: This document is an email chain from October 2021 between a DOJ OIG Special Agent and the Facilities Manager of the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York. The correspondence focuses on an investigation into the timeline of a new camera system installation at MCC New York, specifically questioning why the new system was installed the week after Jeffrey Epstein's death on August 10, 2019, rather than earlier. The emails discuss project start dates, equipment arrival, and installation schedules.

keyFacts: The OIG was investigating why a new camera system at MCC New York, which arrived on site in October 2018, wasn't installed until the week after Jeffrey Epstein's death on August 10, 2019.

The camera project was scheduled to start March 17, 2019, with infrastructure work occurring from March through August 2019, but the actual camera system installation happened the week beginning August 11/12, 2019.
The Facilities Manager stated that when they arrived TDY in February 2019, MCC New York only had one Communication Technician, requiring regional support for the camera installation project.
The email chain reveals the OIG's specific focus on the timing discrepancy between when the camera system was available (October 2018) and when it was actually installed (August 2019).
The correspondence is marked as 'SENSITIVE/PRIVILEGED COMMUNICATION' and contains property of the U.S. Department of Justice, indicating its official investigative nature.
